website_summaries.verdict: The Logical Reasoning sections account for 50% of the LSAT scores, so we recommend this focused study guide as reinforcement.
pros: Includes over 100 real Logical Reasoning LSAT questions
Concentrates on the logic and causality sections of the test
Previous test takers report higher scores on retest
cons: Heavy emphasis on jargon, very dense reading material
Minimal number of test questions per chapter

customer_reviews.title: Best value in LSAT prep
customer_reviews.text: With the help of this book, I went from a 155 on my first practice test to a 170 on the real thing. This book is impeccably written and has concise explanations of confusing logical concepts. The practice questions included are also very good examples of varying difficulty. I would definitely use the Powerscore books (specifically LR) before consulting any more expensive/comprehensive prep company, since I think many will find these books adequate--the value and quality is that good. Their method for approaching Sufficient/Necessary assumption questions in particular was the best I've seen. If you struggle with LR like I did, definitely check out this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FALSE Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: I honestly do not care that this book may work just as well. If you are advertising 2018 Logical Reasoning Bible then I should have received a 2018 book not 2017 otherwise you are false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Faica Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great starting point for learning logical reasoning
customer_reviews.text: I got this book when I first started studying for the LSAT. I found it helpful in learning a subject with which I was unfamiliar but I also found other methods that were more beneficial to my own learning style. The format was helpful to get me familiar with the different types of questions. I would recommend this book to anyone beginning to study for the LSAT with the plan to graduate to more complex material.
customer_reviews.author: Dolmanet

customer_reviews.title: 3 Keys to Efficient LSAT Studying
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best study material for the LSAT. I self-studied with this over about 9 weeks and felt very well prepared going into the October 2015 LSAT. I feel that I bumped my previous score by around 10 points using the PS Bibles the second time around. Here are my 3 keys for efficient studying: 1.) Work through all Powerscore Bibles (LG, LR, RC), 2.) take as many prep tests as possible under times conditions (minimum of 10-15), and 3.) debrief each prep test by throughly reviewing all questions. LSATHacks.com has explanations to all of the prep test questions you miss. Follow this and you'll be on your way to a higher score!
customer_reviews.author: Girlmom515

customer_reviews.title: Decided to go to law school and the next LSAT's ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to go to law school and the next LSAT's were in a month. I only had four weeks to prepare and had been our of school for a 25 years. No test prep classes were available so I decided to try these books. After a few weeks my averages on the practice tests improved to over 160. If you decide to try these just be sure to review your wrong answers.
customer_reviews.author: K W F

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: I took 2 months to read and fully understand the book. This book breaks down each type of question that you might encounter on the LSAT. It also provides practice questions with the explanations of each answer. Pretty good but way too much information to absorb. I would probably say this is a good base but you need other books to supplement because at the end of this book you may not feel 100% confident that you know everything.
customer_reviews.author: kamnj

customer_reviews.title: Tried so many other lsat preps
customer_reviews.text: This one made the most difference. I self-studied for two months with these books and saw improvements. It wasn’t until I took the course that I had the biggest leaps! The PowerScore courses are pricey, but hey our dreams for becoming an attorney are worth more than the cost for these prep materials and courses. And the reality is that the higher the score, the more a school will be willing to fund tuition. So it’s well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: DaniE

customer_reviews.title: Great LSAT study book!
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great book for anyone studying for the LSAT. The author goes over all the important aspects of the question types you’ll see, and the correct/ incorrect answer choices that will appear on the test. It’s thorough and it explains a lot of the methods one needs to perfect in order to get a high score. Since starting this book, I’ve also been trying out Kaplan courses strictly for review. The logical reasoning is explained better in this book than the live Kaplan courses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LSAT - study study
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this book for anyone taking the LSAT entry examine for law school. It’s a great book to help you study yourself or get good practice about the different parts of the exam. I got a very good score just studying this series of books (I believe one for each of the three parts to the exam). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS BOOK! LR MAGIC!
customer_reviews.text: THIS BOOK IS GOLD! It seriously helps so much! i took a kaplan course and spent so much time using kaplan books and learned diddily squat! but PowerScore is AMAZING ! 10/10 recommend. if you struggle with LR then this book is perf for you! LR is by far my worst section but this book is helping understand not only how to find the correct answer but why each answer is wrong. its a long book and really digs deep but omg its a life savor !
customer_reviews.author: Itsaloserthing

customer_reviews.title: Law school bound
customer_reviews.text: Got me into law school! Took the LSAT one time and did great. So I'd say these books are a must!
customer_reviews.author: Brent R Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Incredible resource
customer_reviews.text: This book was pretty incredible. Before working through it, I never felt confident in my answers and consistently got quite a couple wrong in each LR section. After working through this book, I just took my first practice test and found myself much more confident in that i had chosen the correct answers and found a dramatic improvement in how many questions i was getting right. Highly recommend this book to anyone who wants to improve their LSAT score thru mastering the LR section.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Chen

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: The book literally says the 2020 version, yet I got the 2019 version and after requesting for a replacement I STILL got the 2019 version. So annoying because it was supposed to be the digital version which is the version of the lsat I will actually be taking. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Not what was pictured or described
customer_reviews.text: I'm reading through it anyway but this book has writing all throughout (from others doing the exercises therein), and it's the 2016 edition (not the 2019 as pictured). It's disappointing because a huge part of the poitn of these books is to be able to read and practice. My practice opportunity with this copy is shot because someone else has left their practice (writing throughout) in the book (instead of using a separate sheet of paper). It's a rental. Definitely returning!
customer_reviews.author: uniting devices

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I have not taken the LSAT yet but have been scoring well on my practice tests thanks to this book. I love how easy it is to understand and that I can do several chapters a week. I also love the way the authors see the test and think. I have taken courses before but this book has given me a whole new perspective on the LSAT and has made it much easier. I would have started with this book if I could start my LSAT study prep again.
customer_reviews.author: monicaa80

customer_reviews.title: Important to note
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mom and super busy. The first three chapters of this book brought my lsat score up 10pts. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Pangn

customer_reviews.title: Received a ripped up 2014 version after purchasing a new 2020
customer_reviews.text: I’m very angry. I waited for this book for a long time. As logical reasoning is the longest LSAT section, this book was the most important. My order was “order new” on this product which is 2020 version. I received an old very used 2014. 6 years old, really?!? DO NOT BUY. This is not the newest version/ 2020!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S.

customer_reviews.title: From 14/26 to 25/26.
customer_reviews.text: Man is this book thorough. Took a practice logical reasoning test before I read and studied this guide, got 14/26 right. Took one after, got 25/26. Only thing is I wish it had more practice problems, but it does have a good bit so honestly not a whole lot to complain about. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing pages
customer_reviews.text: I’m going back and forth between all three LSAT bibles and this one has pages 33-48 missing. Not sure what I’m missing on those pages which kind of makes studying these a little difficult is I’m focusing on what I might be missing on those pages.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on Blueprint
customer_reviews.text: A must if you want to a high score on the LSAT. I took the blueprint course and their material does not come close to Power Score. I just wish I had purchased all the PowerScore bibles instead of taking the Blueprint course. Don't waste your money on Blueprint!
customer_reviews.author: juan castro

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: This can easily take your LR section up by 3-6 points. The book is easy to follow, and gives you PLENTY of drills along the way. I already had a fairly high LR score. Yet, this book still helped bring my score up. You learn 13 different types of questions and how to approach every one of them step by step. It's a great alternative to taking a prep course, but you need to put the work in. I studied roughly 15-20 hours a week.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Guenther

customer_reviews.title: great lsat book
customer_reviews.text: I bout this for my fiancé so I cannot review it but my fiancé says its a great prep book for the lsat
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: PowerScore is Better than In-Class LSAT Prep Class
customer_reviews.text: The PowerScore LSAT Logical Reasoning Bible is way better than the in-class LSAT prep class (i.e. TestMasters). The techniques clicked with this book and I get to proceed the LSAT at my own pace. Also, I don't need to listen and write notes since I have the text itself. Just a side note, there is a lot of self-disciplining with using prep books over in-class LSAT courses. If you can self-discipline yourself, you will find this book really helpful. Otherwise, stick with the expensive in-class LSAT prep class.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent prep book!
customer_reviews.text: Don't even bother taking the expensive prep classes! I had experience taking prep classes and it did not help me as much as this book did. I would recommend this book to anyone who wants to save time and money while studying for the LSAT. Studying from this book was so much more productive for me because the explanations were more thorough and you can study at your own pace. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard.
customer_reviews.text: Helped me score into the 170s.... I think these books should provide the foundation. You need practice tests, and you need drilling problems, but these books help you learn the ropes. The LR Bible is the best of the series, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User A1

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: It is so hard to read on the digital version unless you have a kindle, I reached out to the company to try to pay the difference and get the hard copy but no one ever got back to me. It's a waste of your money. Would not recommend! It's so hard to study with this version.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is using this to study for her LSAT. She is super happy with it!

customer_reviews.title: Great book for reviewing for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Great book for reviewing for the LSAT. I also have gotten the Princeton Review, but this is much better. If you're looking for practice tests, this isn't the book, but it definitely will teach you everything you need for 2 of the 4 sections of the LSAT. Worth my money.

customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2019 version but I received the 2018 version.

customer_reviews.title: The power score materials are amazing I'd highly recommend getting this resource
customer_reviews.text: The power score materials are amazing I'd highly recommend getting this resource. These books helped me raise my score 5 points from my first to second LSAT.

customer_reviews.title: A Must for LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other PowerScore books, there is a reason that they come so highly recommended. They are very useful in preparing for the LSAT. I used a couple other books at the beginning of my studying, such as LSAT Trainer, which used different methods of teaching, and I decided to stick with this one for its clear, easy-to-understand explanations of different types of Logical Reasoning questions.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this book 0 stars I would. This book misses important details that are necessary in order to perform well on logical reasoning questions. Do not waste your time.

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Necessity
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this book! The writing is very clear, easy to understand and engaging. A very valuable tool when taking on the LSAT! There are a good amount of practice questions after each chapter, which gives you a chance to apply what you learned and see WHY the answers are correct or incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Helpful book. Its a very large book but has ...
customer_reviews.text: Helpful book. Its a very large book but has a lot of helpful information and study aids. I haven't completely finished it yet but it was a fair price compared to other sellers. Hopefully is helps for the exam.
customer_reviews.author: 3eFA

customer_reviews.title: Don't get the kindle version
customer_reviews.text: The book is undeniably helpful as was the logic games bible. The only reason it isn't 5 stars is because the kindle version sucks. Normally I always go for paper but for a variety of reasons, I couldn't this time. The kindle version, however, sometimes cuts off paragraphs prematurely, leaves huge blank spaces, and sometimes skips answer explanations. So basically, get this book but don't opt for kindle. It costs the same but you miss out on some of the info.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is using this guide to study for the LSAT. She states that it has fully prepared her to take the test in the near future!

customer_reviews.title: My Son Is Finding It Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my son who will take the LSAT this fall after completing a prep course. He wanted a book to give him a head start before beginning the prep course and heard from a friend that this was the best book for his purpose. He says it is very good and he is getting a lot of good info from it. Of course, the proof will ultimately be in his LSAT score.

customer_reviews.title: Good book! Very thorough

This book doesn'tcontain any full length practice test, but it does have enough practice problem sets to allow you to grasp the different question types. Definitely a keeper!

If you value your score on the LSAT and are having difficulty preforming to a high standard on the logical reasoning portion of the test, then I highly recommend you buy this book NOW...... Don't wait, get your ass up and go get the book!

customer_reviews.title: They are the BEST resource out there (other than classes) and I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: You need to buy all of the lsat bibles if you are going to take the lsat. They are the BEST resource out there (other than classes) and I can't recommend them enough.

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide for anyone who plans on taking LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Great study guide for anyone who plans on taking LSAT, or who wants to improve their score in this section. I increased my overall score 13 points after studying with this book. Explains how to tackle all types of logical reasoning questions. -First year law student.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money on the powerscore series
customer_reviews.text: While the logic games section might be the hardest the logical reasoning seems to be a larger part of the LSAT. Be prepared and get this. Other books are okay as supplemental materials but powerscore suceeds where others fail and tells you not only why an answer is right, but why wrong answers are wrong. In my opinion this is money well sent. The LSAT is a big deal so you might as well give yourself the best tools possible to suceed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan from WV

customer_reviews.title: great book! Great technique!
customer_reviews.text: I used other book before but it didn't help me like this one! The technique this book uses is so easy to learn and so helpful when I practic the real questions from LSAT. I will recommend this book too everyone!

customer_reviews.text: Thorough, well organized, and straightforward. I've used a Kaplan book before and I can definitely say this one is much better.

customer_reviews.title: Very Informative!

customer_reviews.author: brianna benson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THE BOOK MATERIAL, DISPLEASED WITH KINDLE
customer_reviews.text: I like the book material. It's very thorough and is laid out with good section headers, in a very orderly, systematic manner. However, I bought the book on Kindle, because I didn't want a paper copy and it wasn't available on other e-readers. I don't regret buying it on kindle, but, once more, I am not pleased with the Kindle layout. To charge full price for an ebook that is just slapped together and very very sloppily formatted is unacceptable. Random spaces here there and everywhere; nearly unreadably narrow info boxes; of course no page numbers! Love the book. Displeased with Kindle. Google Play would have done a better job and offered me scanned pages even.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Simons

customer_reviews.title: Great examples, real LSAT test questions
customer_reviews.text: Powerscore provides so much more information than the competition and presents it in a clear, understandable fashion for all levels of test takers. This should be on everyone's list of LSAT resources. Great examples, real LSAT test questions, and useful tips.

I saw my understanding of the reasoning portion of the LSAT improve drastically by the first few chapters. This book is worth more than what I paid for and I am super psyched to blow the June LSAT exam out the window.

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy for Self-Prep

customer_reviews.author: ASam12

customer_reviews.title: If you want to do well on the LSAT then you have to put in the work (if A--->B).
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good book. The information contained in this book filled in several gaps that were left after studying other LSAT books. Other people have mentioned that this book is very thick and I agree, but this information is needed if you truly want to understand and apply the concepts. I think the reason this book is so good is because it does not try to sell you a silver bullet for shortcuts. There are no shortcuts to doing well on the LSAT (or being a good lawyer for that matter). If you want to do well on the LSAT, then you have to put in the work (If A--->B).
customer_reviews.author: FG

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe

customer_reviews.title: All you need
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't have understood logic games without this. This is truly the only book you need.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Costello

customer_reviews.title: Kaplan is better
customer_reviews.text: Kaplan is better. I bought this because the Kaplan book dedicated to the LR section didn't have prime shipping and I needed it fast. Big mistake. This book wastes so many pages with unnecessary detail and not enough pages dedicated to practice problems and "drills". If I hadn't already written in it, I'd return it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Combine with others!
customer_reviews.text: Helped get my score up five points in the last month before retesting. Would definitely buy with the "Logic Games Bible". Lost one star because it can feel disjointed at times- it's organized according to logical principle, while it's presented initially as organized by question groupings. Would still buy regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: It was as expected.
customer_reviews.text: It was as expected. Didn't actually take the LSAT but the book was what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than class!
customer_reviews.text: SO HELPFUL. More so even than the class I am taking!
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Russo

customer_reviews.title: The actual book content is great but the physical book itself is of very poor ...
customer_reviews.text: The actual book content is great but the physical book itself is of very poor quality. The binding looks like trash- looks like a kid took some Elmer's glue and decided to stick the pages today. I don't understand how the pages could be misaligned. If time is not a factor just buy a used copy.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Some methods suggested in this book is questionable and may ...
customer_reviews.text: Some methods suggested in this book is questionable and may not be the most effective way for cracking LSAT. What is more dire is that some analyses of real LSAT questions presented in this book are not complete and omits some important points
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Improved my score by 7 points on a practice test ...
customer_reviews.text: Improved my score by 7 points on a practice test after using this book. Really helps you to learn how to attack the LR sections of the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Love powerscore
customer_reviews.text: Powers core is the best LSAT training out there. Avoid Kaplan
customer_reviews.author: Skinny Yogi

customer_reviews.title: Damaged book.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I received a damage book. Not going to return since I need to start studying right away, but I won't be buying my other study materials here.
customer_reviews.author: E Bradley

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Test Taker
customer_reviews.text: I shall be taking the LSAT in October. I received a very low score last time. I have read many books on the LSAT, and my favorite was the Manhattan series.
customer_reviews.author: LSAT Test Taker

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for me as I prepared for the LSAT. I would highly recommend this book !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Digby

product_meta.title: The PowerScore LSAT Logical Reasoning Bible, 2020 edition. An advanced LSAT prep system for attacking the Logical Reasoning Section, updated for the digital test.
